description: http: document that ServerConn and ClientConn are low-level

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

LGTM

http://codereview.appspot.com/4635081/diff/5001/src/pkg/http/persist.go
File src/pkg/http/persist.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/4635081/diff/5001/src/pkg/http/persist.go#newcode28
src/pkg/http/persist.go:28: // ServerConn is a relatively low-level detail that should not needed
s/relatively // here and below. also what's normal? how about this?
ServerConn is low-level and should not be needed by most applications.
See Server.

http://codereview.appspot.com/4635081/diff/5001/src/pkg/http/persist.go#newcode219
src/pkg/http/persist.go:219: // by normal applications. See Client.
ditto

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=916057d73e34 ***

http: document that ServerConn and ClientConn are low-level

R=golang-dev, r
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/4635081

http://codereview.appspot.com/4635081/diff/5001/src/pkg/http/persist.go
File src/pkg/http/persist.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/4635081/diff/5001/src/pkg/http/persist.go#newcode28
src/pkg/http/persist.go:28: // ServerConn is a relatively low-level detail that should not needed
On 2011/06/30 01:15:35, r wrote:
> s/relatively // here and below. also what's normal? how about this?
> ServerConn is low-level and should not be needed by most applications.
> See Server.

Relative to the rest of the http package but you're right that it's ambiguous. I like your text.

subject: code review 4635081: http: document that ServerConn and ClientConn are low-level
